intro: Monanthotaxis faulknerae, commonly known as the Falkner's monanthotaxis, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes other economically important plants like the cashew and poison ivy. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It is often found in lowland rainforests and is adapted to thrive in humid, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
